did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Mrs. M.W. Sterling’s documents donated to Bauman L. Belden
did.abstract: Documents sent by M.W. Sterling to Bauman L. Belden

scopecontent.p: Eleven documents including newspaper clippings and handwritten notes that probably date between the early and late nineteenth century. One newspaper article dated from August 29, 1829 mentions medals presented to surviving seamen for heroic service aboard the British ship Beaufort Castle, which was wrecked in the Atlantic Ocean on October 8, 1828. This article would have been of interest to Belden since he was working on a project involving life saving medals at the time of his death. Another (undated) article, entitled “Old America Coins,” describes nine pre-colonial American copper coins.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bauman L. Belden (1862-1931) of Cranford, New Jersey, served the American Numismatic Society as librarian (1891-1896), secretary (1896-1903, 1905-1916), director (1909-1915), and council member (1906-1928). He sat on several Society committees, including the Committee on Indian Peace Medals, which he chaired. He was the author of Medals and Publications of the American Numismatic Society (1915), Indian Peace Medals Issued in the United States (1927), and A Mint in New York (1930). He was a member of the American Numismatic Association and was active in the New York Numismatic Club. At the time of his death he was working on a project involving life saving medals.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The documents were compiled by Mrs. M.W. Sterling and sent from Detroit.
